required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Use During Sex and Its Impact on Taking PrEP (Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis) : CONSUME
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Chemsex (Drug Use in a Sexual Context) Among MSM (Men Who Have Sex With Men) and Transgender People in France, Whether or Not Taking PrEP, and Its Impact on PrEP Adherence

brief_summary.textblock: This is a cross-sectional, single-center observational study conducted from October 2020 to March 2021 in Ile de France at the infectious disease of CHU Bichat (PrEP and CeGIDD(Free Center for Information, Screening and Diagnosis of Infections by Human Immunodeficiency Viruses, Viral Hepatitis and Sexually Transmitted Infections) consultation). It concerns adult subjects of male or transgender sex, of MSM (men having sex with men) or bi-sexual orientation. The data are collected by self-questionnaire evaluating the consumption of Chemsex (drug use in a sexual context) over the last 12 months, the existence or not of addiction treatment, the history of STIs (sexually transmitted infections) and adherence to PrEP (for subjects taking PrEP) during the last sexual intercourse (ANRS questionnaire, used in the PREVENIR study).

primary_outcome.measure: compare in an MSM and transgender population, the use of Chemsex depending on whether or not PrEP is taken

secondary_outcome.measure: The existence or not of psychological comorbidity and the existence of addictological care
The number of sexually transmitted infections at inclusion

arm_group.description: of sexual orientation MSM (men having sex with men) or bi-sexual, consultant in sexual health centers

intervention.description: self-questionnaire assessing Chemsex's (drug use in a sexual context) consumption over the last 12 months

study_pop.textblock: The study concerns subjects of male or transgender sex, of MSM or bi-sexual sexual orientation, consulting in sexual health centers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age> 18
- male or transgender
- MSM or bi-sexual orientation
- adult consultant at Bichat Hospital (CeGIDD or PrEP consultation)
- adult with a Smartphone (online self-questionnaire)
Exclusion Criteria:
- For the group "taking PrEP": adult taking PrEP for less than 3 months
- Refusal of participation

eligibility.gender_description: male or transgender MSM or bi-sexual orientation
